title.narrative: DATA FOR IMPROVED POLICY

description.narrative: Capacities and systems at national and sub-national levels related to maternal, newborn, and child health outcomes are strengthened, data driven and relevant for improved policy, programmes, dialogue, advocacy, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Maternal And Newborn Health, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access and increased utilization of quality and equity focused Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) and immunization services for mothers, new born, U5 children and adolescent girls in most deprived provinces and areas

sector.narrative: Data analysis, including situation analysis and update
Research, monitoring, evaluation and knowledge management for SBC

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacities and systems at national and sub-national levels related to maternal, newborn, and child health outcomes are strengthened, data driven and relevant for improved policy, programmes, dialogue, advocacy

description.narrative: UNICEF supported evidence generation that guide equitable delivery of Maternal, Newborn, Child, and Adolescent health (RMNCAH) services, and Expanded Programme on Immunization (EPI) services.;UNICEF is working closely with Ministry of Public Health (MoPH) to develop Primary Health Care (PHC) model with focus on community level. this will help increase coverage and equity for the Global Strategy for Every Woman and Every Child’s Health;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
